Event.name: Standing_by
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Protagonist</fen> waits for an <fen>Expected_request</fen>, and is prepared to respond to the request when it comes by engaging in an <fen>Activity</fen>. Alternatively, the <fen>Protagonist</fen> waits for a <fen>Salient_entity</fen> involved in the request, most often realized as the person making the request.
<ex><fex name="pro">Police</fex> have been <t>standing by</t> <fex name="exp">for further orders regarding the protesters</fex> <fex name="Duration">for over two hours</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="pro">Our staff</fex> are <t>on call</t> <fex name="Time">24 hours a day</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Protagonist
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The sentient being who delays action until an <fen>Expected_request</fen> has been received.
<ex><fex name="pro">He</fex> was <t>on call</t> every night this week.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Salient_entity
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A concrete or abstract entity that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> expects to participate in an <fen>Expected_request</fen>, typically the party that makes the request of the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
<ex>Riot officers are <t>standing by</t> <fex name="sal">for protesters</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is waiting for the request.
<ex>At least 17 ships were <t>standing by</t> <fex name="Time">yesterday</fex> to commence the attack.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is waiting.
<ex>Guards are <t>standing by</t> <fex name="pla">outside the State Guesthouse</fex> for new orders.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Duration</fen> denotes the length of time from the beginning of the waiting to its end.
<ex>She was on <t>standby</t> <fex name="dur">for three hours</fex> last night, but no one showed up.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the waiting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>) and salient characteristics of the <fen>Protagonist</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>patiently</ment>, <ment>anxiously</ment>).
<ex>Troops were <fex name="man">silently</fex> standing by for the order to arrive.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Expected_request
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Expected_request</fen> is what triggers the <fen>Protagonist</fen> to proceed with an appropriate action.
<ex>She did n't <t>stand by</t> <fex name="exp">for them to supply her with orders</fex>; she just rushed right in.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: End_point
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The point in time, defined either as a clock time or in terms of an event that takes place, at which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> ends the waiting.
<ex> I'll be <t>on call</t> until 4am.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the occurrence of the waiting event logically follows.
<ex>Senior employees are <t>on call</t> over the weekend <fex name="Explanation">because it was discovered that it was difficult, if not disasterous, to rely entirely on new hires</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the <fen>Protagonist</fen> as being in some state during the waiting.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> intends to accomplish by standing by.
<ex>Our experienced technitions are <t>standing by</t> to assist you <fex name="pur">in order to get you back up and running as soon as possible</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Co-participant
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Co-participant</fen> is an entity that participates in a coordinated way in the waiting event with the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
<ex>I was <t>on call</t> <fex name="Co-participant">with several other doctors</fex> so at least it wasn't too boring.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Activity
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Protagonist</fen> is prepared to conduct an <fen>Activity</fen> in response to the <fen>Expected_request</fen>.
<ex>We're <t>on call</t> <fex name="act">to answer all of your questions</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: on call.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: ready for and awaiting a request.

lexUnit.name: on station.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: prepared to offer military support when called upon (esp. said of aircraft or ships in support of ground troops).
